title: posters for personal exhibition
content:
Hello typophilers,

it’s been a long time since my last post  
and i missed being around the block.

So, here I come up with a series of posters  
I did for a small exhibition of unpublished  
works of mine created during the last  
5 years.If your way happento cross  
Thessaloniki you could contact with me  
to visit the exhibition. It will be open  
untill midof November (maybe it will  
last even more).

About the posters, I used two layers:  
a constant one with the information  
in handmade lettering  
and the background layer  
which is changing, taking different  
photos I shot around the city or  
in friends’ houses.

The posters are not trying to describe  
the exhibition. They are a theme  
by themselves, though, inevitably  
they give a hint of my graphic style,  
which is what you are going to watch  
in the exhibition.

By the posters I wanted to address  
to people who live in the same (urban)  
environment as me. The photos present  
this environment, which at this point  
is filtered by my eyes. So, actually  
I state my existence in this place  
we share.

christos

comments.content: Pretty strong, Christos, pretty strong! What size will they be? Kudos on getting an exhibition on your work! We don’t really have graphic design exhibitions round these parts.

The format is A3, printed by laser/colour printer.

―christos

Kris, I am astonished by your work in typography!  
Especially by the notebooks; i think it is a beutifull  
idea to put your roughs in the site. My favourites are  
Karv Sans, Slabb and Eliza (with its “Dorothy” variation),  
but I really miss a PDF with all characters.  
Do you plan to upload one in the future?

Congratulations and please tell me what “kia ora” means?  
Is it a maory phrase?

―christos
